ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Recite to them the story of Ibrahim
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Relate the news of Abraham to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And recount to them the story of Abraham:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Your Lord is certainly Majestic and All-merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And recite to them the news of Ibrahim.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And recite to them the tiding of Abraham
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Recite unto them the story of Abraham:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Tell them the story of Abraham,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And recite unto them the story of Ibrahim.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Relate to them the account of Abraham
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham's story.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim (Abraham).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And recite to them the news of Abraham.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And relate to them the story of Abraham.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And recite to them the news of Abraham,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:69] And recite to them, the disbelievers of Mecca, the tiding, the tale, of Abraham (Ibrāhīma is substituted by [the following, idh qāla, ‘when he said’])
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Recite unto them) unto Quraysh, your people (the story of Abraham) the event of Abraham in the Qur'an:
